com.xhive.query.interfaces
Interface XhiveQueryResultIf

public interface XhiveQueryResultIf

Represents an XPath/XPointer query result.

The result can be of one of several types: a location set, a boolean, a string, or a number, where XPath specific rules determine the outcome of conversion. For example, getStringValue() returns the string value of the query result according to XPath conversion rules. Note the getLocationSetValue() throws an exception if the query result does not represent a location set. Further instructions on how to handle a location set can be found in the documentation on XhiveLocationIteratorIf and XhiveLocationIf.

The query result has an XhiveAuthorityIf object that controls access to it.

The result of a query expires when you make the first commit after the XhiveQueryIf.execute() call by which the query was generated. If you want a query result to survive a commit, the strategy is to make it persistent by adding it to a user's XhiveQueryResultListIf, from which it can be later retrieved by name.

XQuery queries always return an iterator that returns XhiveXQueryValueIf objects.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)
